Package com.landawn.abacus.util

Class If

java.lang.Object
com.landawn.abacus.util.If
@Beta public final class If extends Object
This class is mainly designed for functional programming. Generally the traditional "if-else" or ternary operator: "? : " is preferred over this class.
See Also:
  • N.ifOrEmpty(boolean, Throwables.Supplier)
  • N.ifOrElse(boolean, Throwables.Runnable, Throwables.Runnable)
  • N.ifNotNull(Object, Throwables.Consumer)
  • N.ifNotEmpty(CharSequence, Throwables.Consumer)
  • N.ifNotEmpty(Collection, Throwables.Consumer)
  • N.ifNotEmpty(Map, Throwables.Consumer)

    • then

      public <E extends Throwable> If.OrElse then(Throwables.Runnable<E> cmd) throws IllegalArgumentException, E
      Executes the provided runnable if the condition is true.
      Type Parameters:
      E - the type of exception that the runnable may throw
      Parameters:
      cmd - the runnable to execute if the condition is true
      Returns:
      an instance of OrElse to allow further conditional operations
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the provided runnable is null
      E - if the runnable throws an exception

    • then

      @Beta public <T, E extends Throwable> If.OrElse then(T init, Throwables.Consumer<? super T,E> action) throws IllegalArgumentException, E
      Executes the provided consumer action if the condition is true.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the input to the consumer
      E - the type of exception that the consumer may throw
      Parameters:
      init - the initial input to the consumer
      action - the consumer action to execute if the condition is true
      Returns:
      an instance of OrElse to allow further conditional operations
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the provided action is null
      E - if the consumer action throws an exception

    • thenThrow

      public <E extends Throwable> If.OrElse thenThrow(Supplier<? extends E> exceptionSupplier) throws IllegalArgumentException, E
      Throws the exception provided by the supplier if the condition is true.
      Type Parameters:
      E - the type of exception that may be thrown
      Parameters:
      exceptionSupplier - the supplier that provides the exception to be thrown
      Returns:
      an instance of OrElse to allow further conditional operations
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the provided exception supplier is null
      E - if the condition is true and the exception supplier provides an exception
